channel.title: How is this possible?
channel.description:
Hows this possible? I'm having troubles with Java compiling. Regular java shit works, like runescape n shit, but my server wont compile? I have the environment variables. Someone please teamview me.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/MSqZb.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/DiL4S.png[/img]
Classpath code:
[code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_2\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
Path code:
[code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin[/code]
What the hell am I doing wrong?
I have teamviewer.
Thanks, anthonyduka

item.title: How is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

JDK is related to compiling, JRE is related to running Java-based things. In this case, you’re trying to compile with the JRE and not the JDK. You shouldn’t really need to edit the classpath.

Read full topic

item.title: How is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[size=3]so, here you put you have java1.7.0_2[/size]

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_2\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

[/code][size=3]but here in your program files you have java1.6.0_30
[/size][code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin

[size=3]so, you need to chnage your class path to:[/size]

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Read full topic

item.title: How is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @devenb123 devenb123
item.description:
@devenb123 wrote:

Make your class and classpath using the same jdk version.

Read full topic

item.title: How is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Path (computing)

A path, the general form of the name of a file or directory, specifies a unique location in a file system. A path points to a file system location by following the directory tree hierarchy expressed in a string of characters in which path components, separated by a delimiting character, represent each directory. The delimiting character is most commonly the slash ("/"), the backslash character ("\"), or colon (":"), though some operating systems may use a different delimiter. Paths are used exten...

Read full topic

item.title: How is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @anthonyduka anthonyduka
item.description:
@anthonyduka wrote:

Hows this possible? I’m having troubles with Java compiling. Regular java shit works, like runescape n shit, but my server wont compile? I have the environment variables. Someone please teamview me.

MSqZb.png750×478

Classpath code:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_2\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path code:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin

What the hell am I doing wrong?

I have teamviewer.

Thanks,
anthonyduka

Read full topic
